intro: Crepis songorica, commonly known as the Songorica hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the island of Java in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Crepis songorica is a herbaceous perennial, often found in lowland and coastal regions of its native habitat.
